quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [knocks water bottle on to Jim's desk] Oh, little help. Wow your hair is really thinning.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Standing is proven to be healthier, increases productivity and just looks cooler. Picture someone doing something heroic. Now was he sitting or standing? Not counting FDR.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Every second you sit there is an hour off your life. Look at all of you. I feel like you’re in a suicide cult.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: No. No. No. You’re way off on that one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Are you really comfortable standing there? I tried one of those and I just never hit the sweet spot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey guys let’s just all admit it. Ok? Dwight’s better than us. He had the guts to stop sitting. And he’s never, ever going to go back on it right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s right Jim.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [jumping up from an almost sitting position] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Taking a load off huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No. Putting a load on more like it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Good luck with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Last thing I need is luck. [hunches down again]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [to Angela] Thank you so much. [hums]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [sees a pole poking out Dwight’s pant leg] What are you up to? Oops look out! [grabs Dwight's wallet]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What are you doing? Give that back. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Prank! [throws money from Dwight’s wallet on the floor]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh that’s real creative.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know what it’s not my best. Because you could just easily bend over and pick it up right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I could, but I just don’t feel like it loser.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because you’re sitting?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Standing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don’t!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Because you’re sitting?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Standing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You know I have to do this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know. [Jim pushes him over, Dwight screams]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [signing his name] Andrew… Baines… Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think you could just do Andy Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Andrew Baines Bernard. I love filling these out. Because it’s like taking a test, but I know the answers.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [loudly knocking on the window] In four seconds my wife is going to be coming through that door. I told her she could work here. Under no circumstances can that be allowed to happen. [to Mrs. California] There you are! Honey how on earth could you miss the elevator?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don’t know. He wasn’t talking to me. But if I were you I wouldn’t hire his wife.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: That’s why my foundation – The Dream for a Wish Foundation – is going to put them out of business. They’re not going to know what hit them.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Everyone. I’d like to introduce my wife Mrs. Robert California. Mrs. California this is everyone.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Hello. Oh call me Susan please.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Last night at dinner Susan and I were talking about her returning to work. So she’s here today to see if there’s a good fit. Something tells me it just might work out. This is Andy Bernard the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Hello nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey there. It’s a pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Andy would you be so kind as to show Susan around the office. Show her the various departments. Find a place where she’ll shine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I would love to. But I have to be completely honest with you guys. We’re 100 percent staffed up.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Andy. Let’s see if there’s a good fit first. Then we’ll talk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Knock, knock, knock, knock, knock.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You don’t have to say it if you’re doing it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [laughs] Remember how you said that you were looking in the office to do calisthenics and aerobics?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Uh weight lifting yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well today’s your lucky day. I have opened in this very office building Dwight Schrute’s Gym for Muscles. You wanna take a look?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I’ll take a look.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Your path from obesity begins right here!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I’ve been meaning to join a gym. [narrating over a montage of scenes with him and Val] For my health. I used to say I wanted to live long enough to see a black President. I didn’t realize how easy that would be. So now I want to live long enough to see a really, really gay President. Or a supermodel President. I want to see all the different kinds of Presidents.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Obese people in my office are a drain on resources. Chairs wear out faster, it takes more Freon to keep them cool, they flush the toilets more often, plus their massive BMs bust the rivets on my pipes. But a gym turns fat into cash.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright! The DM Express is pulling out.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Well it was really nice to meet you Brian.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Actually Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Oh, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Bitttch!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We will start here at Erinville.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hoo-hoo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Reception. Your classic one-man operation.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Although I was watching a movie and Merryl Streep had two secretaries.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I was watching a movie and a bunch of apes took over San Francisco. Just saying.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Two secretaries could convey a sense of importance and success to our clients. Certainly worth exploring; wouldn’t you agree Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I’ll explore exploring it.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Good. It seems like you have this under control. So I’ll just duck out and run the company for a while.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ok uh next stop on the tour sales. Here we go. Station stop Jim Halpert. Oh boy our resident truth teller. [Jim laughs nervously] Alright have at it. Let ‘er rip. What do you hate about this place?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well it’s sales. So you have to be able to live in the world of rejection.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Maybe you do. Hi. I’m Dwight. Sales is really not so hard ok? It’s paper. We have it and they want it so bad they are willing to pay for it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Well it’s not that easy. It’s kind of sometimes difficult.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It’s the second easiest job in the world. [to camera] Being a mom.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: I love shopping and sales is just the other side of that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That is true.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know if you joined our sales department you would be working very closely with our department head Mr. Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Dwight why don’t you tell Susan about some of your hobbies. Survival skills. Ranking of animals.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Maybe over a beer after she’s closed her first sale [makes gun click noise].

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Well make that a red wine and I’ll tell you my animal rankings [makes gun click noise back].

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh how am I supposed to pull this off? [montage of office workers in friendly interactions with Susan]. The entire office is being nice to her than they’ve ever been to me. What I wouldn’t give for one of Phyllis’ classic room clearing farts right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ready? What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Um no. This is not a gym. This is like a scene out of Saw 5.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You haven’t even looked around yet. Look. Gravel bucket squat yoke [squats, grunts and lifts] Right? Dedicated phone book ripping station [tries and fails to tear a phone book in half]. You ever cut tin before? Five yards in and your forearms will be on fire. Plus I will buy the tin back from you that you cut for two cents a yard. Now let’s go over membership. I’m going to need the first month’s and the last month’s up front. $49 per month. But every third month is $59 a month. But the fourth month is a discount month at $19 per month…

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Obviously you know how a gym works. So you know I’m not going to pay money for this. You want people to come to your gym? Make a real gym.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Darryl... [picks up sledgehammer and swings it at a hanging tire]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Make a real gym.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: I was thinking accounting might be a good fit because I really clicked with Oscar and I do have some experience in bookkeeping.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: But we already have a surplus of accountants as it is.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Uh I could work in customer service. HR even.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Those are fully staffed as well.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Are you telling me that there’s no one in this entire office that could use an extra pair of hands?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [laughing nervously] Yes.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I am the CEO and I am telling an employee of mine what to do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let me beat around the bush for a second. Our chairman of the board has some very strong feelings about-

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Robert this is very uncomfortable. Obviously there’s no place for me here. So thank you for trying. Why don’t we just let it go.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No. Absolutely not. Andrew there must be something you can do. Think.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: There are lots of considerations.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I would be eternally grateful. It’s not a bad thing to have the CEO owe you one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright. Well then welcome aboard.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: So what happens next?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We get you over to HR and then we get you set up with accounting. [phone rings] Hang on. Hello?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [on phone] Say hello grandma.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi gam-gam.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Hold one finger up to Susan. You’ll just be a second. You numbskull. You were given a very simple task. I could not have been more clear with you. Now say, “are you taking your medicine?”

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you taking your med-meds?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Why can you not say exactly what I tell you? Undo this. Undo it. [Robert and Andy hang up phones]

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: You didn’t say goodbye to your grandma.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We promised we’d never say goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Attention! I am now accepting memberships for Dwight Schrute’s Gym for Muscles. The first 20 members can take advantage of the pay what you weigh promotion.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: All I need is another gym. As if I don’t have enough drama.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: We have a gym at home. It’s called the bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Who’s spotting who? Don’t use the bike in the corner. That’s Bruce’s. Jeremy says…

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Enough Oscar, enough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I have these new sneakers which are basically like a gym for your feet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That’s okay. I know how to build a business. You gotta get the black people to do it to get the white people to do it. Then you gotta get the black people to stop doing it. One step at a time.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Did you bring your passport with you?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Who walks around with their passport?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well, I do. Always ready for adventure.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Have you had any?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [sees Susan is busy in the annex] Hey, uh, guys. So Robert doesn't want his wife working here. So now that she is, we have to drive her away.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Andy, if he didn't want her working here then why did you hire her?

quotes.speaker: Andy/Oscar
quotes.line: it was a mistake. But one that can be fixed by all of us being mean to her.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: How can we do that? She's simply wonderful.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: This is all pathetic.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am not asking, I am ordering.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: How mean are we talking about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It would be great if she were gone by lunch. Erin, you're up. Find her a place to work, but not too comfortable.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Got it. I know exactly which stapler to give her.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Here you go. [gives Susan a tiny stapler]

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Um, do you think it would be possible to move to that desk over there? Because this seems a bit cramped and I don't have a computer.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well that's a sales desk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. You need to be over here with us accountants. Just sit here and be quiet. And if you have a question, just raise your hand. But I'm gonna save you some time, sweetie, and give you the answer now. I. Don't. Know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, I don't think we should be trying to make this place seem unpleasant. I think we should let this place just crush her spirit by itself. I mean, it knows what it's doing.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That's Gerald. [hands phone to Jim]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, wow. So cute.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Oh, that is so cute-

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [grabs phone] Aw... He's so tiny. Is he in a ladle?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah, he's in a ladle.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: That's adorable. How on earth did you get him in a ladle?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: He did it himself.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Is that ladle stainless or...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Oh, stainless. Williams Sonoma.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Excuse me, waiter, there's a dog in my soup. [Jim chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It's not that kind of ladle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Very cute. [holds out the phone]

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Aw, let me see-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [grabs phone] Ah, just the battery on these things. I'm sorry, I've got to recharge this.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: I get it. Last time I had a job, I remember I hated the boss' wife. Of course, she was married to Robert.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Your employees don't seem to be taking to me.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Andy! Andy, could you step in here, please? We'll fix this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [in robot voice] What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [chuckles] Please. Andrew, my wife... has brought up an issue that requires your attention. So, uh, if you'll excuse me, I should step out, get to the ATM before that homeless man sets up camp for the night.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okey-dokey, artichokey. You hate it, don't you?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Do you not want me here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why would you say that?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: It's okay. I understand. I'm not sure how I would feel about having the boss' wife work for me either.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It's not that, exactly.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: But it is something.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Let's just say that if you don't want to work here, I am totally prepared to respect that.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Why would you not want me working here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don't know. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: I think I understand what you're going through. My husband can be a very difficult man to read, can't he?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes! The dude is an enigma.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Mm-hmm. So he is mixed up in this, isn't he?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ah... [stammers]

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Got it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you think you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Getting my sweat on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I build you this temple to the human body, and you're lifting what, five pounds?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I just did, like, 35 minutes on the treadmill.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I was watching you. You want to know how long it really was?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Eight minutes!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Dude, I'm gonna be here all week, right? Five days a week, I figure I'll start slow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Is that the same philosophy you apply to buffalo wings? [points] I want you to bring that same buffalo wing passion to this gym! I'm gonna make you look like Lebron James!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's Lejon Brames.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: That's what I said.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You know, get it right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [to Susan] Cameras...

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [enters] Oh, still here. Terrific.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Andy and I had a great conversation. And I just want to let you know that I am not going to be working here.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Well that's a shame.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It just was one of those things-

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Is it? Because we talked about it and it seems like that might be what you want. Which is fine.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Where did this come from? Did Andy say that?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: No, he did not, but I could tell he was struggling to understand what was expected of him.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: What's the struggle? He made a great call, hired a great person.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: You sure about that?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: No games?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No games.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Because Andy seemed to think there was some information he was not able to share with me.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Okay, enough of this. I mean, really, enough. It's gotten way out of hand. Andrew, this is my wife. Whatever privacy you were trying to protect between us, I thank you for. But it is not welcome right now. Just be honest.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Why do you keep looking at my husband?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Andy, just answer the question.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No games?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No games.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay. I mean, it was kind of funny, actually. Robert storms in and he says, "in four seconds, my wife's gonna be in here. I told her she could work here. Under no circumstances can that be allowed to happen." [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: You lying son of a bitch!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Tell my wife you're lying.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am lying. I am a compulsive liar.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: That's not true, is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No, it's not. I tell the truth most of the time and I was just telling the truth about your husband. Jim knows. He was there.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: This is preposterous.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Robert...

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Let's get Jim in here. [Jim shoves out of fram in his chair, Robert looks for Jim] Where's Jim?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: He just rolled out and crawled out.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Can you call security, tell 'em to keep an eye out for him? Time to settle this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [to Hank who is closing the gate] Oh wait, wait, wait! Hold on, hold on. I just need to get through. Just real quick. Real quick, open... uh, okay. [runs]

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [sees Jim's abandoned car] That's weird. Well, he's gotta be around here somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [shoe falls while climbing ladder] Oh. Ow. Ow. Ow. [grunts] Creed. I was never here, all right?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Okay. What about your friend?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh boy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is my gym, my rules. You do exactly as I say, no questions asked.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah, I'm gonna ask questions and I might not do what you say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: First thing, we're gonna stretch the pelvic bowl. Ready? Get down on the floor.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Okay, I'm not doing that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really? Too embarrassing for you? Huh? You wish that every exercise was strutting around the gym like the Fonz? Well how do you think the Fonz got so cool? He stretched his pelvic bowl!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I didn't know Darryl joined.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Looks that way.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Nice pelvic bowl. Deep.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Hello Jim. [Jim tries to escape]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [grabs Jim's leg] No, no. No, no, no! Don't! Damn it, Tuna!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: So I think you know what we want to know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do I?

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [mutters] I know, I do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Jim, I've had enough of your unhelpfulness.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I really wish I could help. I'm not really sure how I can...

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: For God's sake, did Robert tell you that he didn't want me working here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's the thing. See, I didn't want to get in the middle of this. Still don't. But here's something: I feel that maybe, if we take a step back, this is a simple case of anxiety to work with a spouse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [laughs] I think we've got ourselves an answer.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That makes complete sense. Thank you all for a wonderful day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Perfect!

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Jim...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Answer the question, please.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [sighs] I don't know what you want me to tell you. To be really honest, my wife works here. And I love it. She literally makes me work harder. She makes me smarter. She makes me remember why I'm here. And between us, she's on maternity leave right now, and I would love to leave this room and see her face. I would love it. I don't know how this helps, but it's just what I'm thinking.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: All right. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes. All right. Great. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: [Robert holds the door, she walks through] Thank you. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: [claps Andy's shoulder] Heh.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, Mrs. California.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Hey. Uh, I'm sorry about the position you were put in today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You know, honestly, we all wanted you to work there. Except for him. Especially me.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Yeah, I thought we really hit it off.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Well, different circumstances.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Who knows?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Who knows?

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: Maybe after all this settles down...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Totally.

quotes.speaker: Susan
quotes.line: It's a date.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You're nothing! You're so weak, you call yourself a man? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: This doesn't help me. I don't respond to that kind of strategy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay, fine. Finish your set on your own and never come back to my gym again!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Dwight, come back and spot me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right, I'll help you. But first, you gotta tell me what your goal is. What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: To push this bar up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! Because if that was the case, the bar would be up by now. What is your goal?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Help me!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What do you want!?!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: To look good for Val!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Val Kilmer? I don't buy it. That doesn't make any sense. Wow... I figured out your goal. I am going to make you the buffest dude Val Kilmer has ever seen.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: They say that if you can strengthen your core, it improves your sexual performance. So, you will find me on the Ab-Blaster. And then you will find me blasting...uh, a very nice young woman.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Gotta get in shape. I'm doing Ironman next month. And I want him to be attracted to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, what are you listening to?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Steve Martin. [laughs, then falls] uh, I'm fine. [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Um, where's the shower?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There is no shower.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.line: There isn't?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What does this look like, a shower store? Get lost.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You have got to be kidding me! No shower?!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Exercise lengthens life. Improves mood, boosts sex drive, and I've already covered the BM of it all. It's miraculous the effect that I will have on their lives.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So, Roberto Californio doesn't want to work with his wife. I get it. And, he wants to give his wife a job. Totally get it. What I am struggling with is the part of this that's impossible.

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: I love my wife.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This whole thing is making me very uncomfortable. I'm not getting between the boss and his wife so just ask me about something else. You know Stanley's tie is really the story of the day...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: It's my birthday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok, so that's a disaster. Luckily have a two-part plan. One, run. Two, hide. It's pretty smart, right? [walks into Vance Refrigeration office] Hi, how you doing? I'm Jim Halpert from across the hall. We are redoing our supply closet and I was wondering if I could take a look at yours for some ideas.

quotes.speaker: Bob's Secretary
quotes.line: Let me just check with Bob.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You absolutely should. He said it was ok, so till you get him, I'll just be in, you know. [closes door behind him to supply closet]

quotes.speaker: Bob's Secretary
quotes.line: [on phone] Bob? Jim just went into the closet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ugh! He's always one step ahead of us! How does he do that?

quotes.speaker: Mrs. California
quotes.line: This is insulting!

quotes.speaker: Robert California
quotes.line: This whole accusation is insulting. Come on.
